evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendant TRICARE is the healthcare program that covers Jane and John Doe. TRICARE manages and oversees an integrated healthcare delivery system. Its director reports to and operates under the authority, direction, and control over the Director of the DHA.

extracted.value: Defendant: TRICARE Health Plan, healthcare program covering Jane and John Doe

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiff Jane Doe is a 21-year-old transgender woman who is entitled to receive healthcare benefits through the military’s TRICARE Health Plan (“TRICARE”), by virtue of being an eligible dependent of her father, Plaintiff John Doe.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Jane Doe is a 21-year-old transgender woman who is entitled to receive healthcare benefits through the military’s TRICARE Health Plan by virtue of being an eligible dependent of her father, Plaintiff John Doe

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Jane’s father, Plaintiff John Doe, retired from the U.S. military as a Senior Master Sergeant after more than 23 years of honorable service in both the Marine Corps and Air Force. As a benefit of his honorable service, John, his wife Susan Doe, and their only child (and dependent) Jane Doe receive healthcare through the Military Health System—specifically, through TRICARE. John Doe is considered the “TRICARE Sponsor” for Jane.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: John Doe retired from the U.S. military as a Senior Master Sergeant after more than 23 years of honorable service in both the Marine Corps and Air Force, and is the TRICARE Sponsor for Jane Doe

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendant Lloyd J. Austin, III is the Secretary of Defense to the United States and leads the Department of Defense (“DoD”). He is authorized to establish DoD policies, to include promulgating DoD Directives and Instructions that interpret and implement enacted federal law. Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 702, Defendant Austin oversees the administration of TRICARE and, as such, he has a duty to ensure that TRICARE is administered properly in accordance with the Constitution and the laws of the United States.

extracted.value: Defendant: Lloyd J. Austin, III is the Secretary of Defense to the United States and leads the Department of Defense (DoD), overseeing TRICARE administration

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendant DoD is an agency of the United States government. DoD manages the needs of servicemembers and their families and oversees the military healthcare system.

extracted.value: Defendant: U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) is an agency of the United States government managing servicemembers' healthcare and overseeing the military healthcare system

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendant Defense Health Agency (“DHA”) is an executive agency within the DoD and is funded through federal defense appropriations. DHA manages and operates the TRICARE health program, which provides worldwide medical, dental, and pharmacy programs to uniformed service members, retirees, and their families.

extracted.value: Defendant: Defense Health Agency (DHA) is an executive agency within the DoD managing and operating the TRICARE health program
